episodeTitle: Completely Infuriated! Kuro vs. Luffy, Final Battle!
episodeTitleJapanese: 怒り爆発！クロVSルフィ決着の行方！
episodeTitleRomanized: Ikari bakuhatsu! Kuro tai Rufi ketchaku no yukue!
description: Luffy and Kuro's battle reaches its climax as Luffy unleashes a devastating headbutt technique. Meanwhile, Usopp and Zoro defeat Jango, ending the Black Cat Pirates' threat to Syrup Village. After the victory, Kaya gifts the Going Merry to the Straw Hats, and Usopp officially joins the crew as their fourth member.

events.title: Luffy vs Kuro Final Battle Intensifies
events.description: The final confrontation between Luffy and Captain Kuro reaches its climax. Kuro's plan is unraveling and he becomes increasingly enraged as Luffy continues to fight back against his calculated schemes.
events.significance: This battle represents the culmination of the Syrup Village arc's central conflict and demonstrates Luffy's determination to protect his friends and their dreams.

quotes.text: My plan...My plan...My plan cannot fail!!!
quotes.speaker: Kuro
quotes.context: Kuro losing his composure as his carefully laid plan falls apart

events.title: Banchina Appears in Flashback
events.description: Usopp's mother Banchina appears for the first time in a flashback sequence. She is shown bedridden with an illness, representing the tragic loss that shaped Usopp's childhood and his habit of telling stories.
events.significance: Reveals crucial backstory about Usopp's mother and provides context for his character's development, particularly his tendency to lie and his connection to his father Yasopp.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Kane Debut
events.description: Luffy debuts his Gomu Gomu no Kane (Rubber Rubber Bell) technique, a powerful headbutt attack. He uses his rubber body to restrain Kuro, then delivers a devastating headbutt that shatters Kuro's glasses and renders him unconscious.
events.significance: This is the first appearance of this signature technique that Luffy will use throughout the series. It demonstrates creative use of his rubber powers beyond simple punches and kicks.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy announcing his new headbutt technique against Kuro

events.title: Kuro's Defeat
events.description: Captain Kuro is defeated by Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Kane technique. His glasses are destroyed and he falls unconscious, marking the end of his three-year plan to steal Kaya's fortune.
events.significance: Concludes the main conflict of the Syrup Village arc. Kuro's defeat saves Kaya's life and protects the village from the Black Cat Pirates.

events.title: Kayaku Boshi Debut
events.description: Usopp uses his Kayaku Boshi (Gunpowder Star) technique to defeat Jango. This explosive projectile from his slingshot proves to be a one-shot knockout against the hypnotist.
events.significance: First appearance of one of Usopp's signature attacks. Demonstrates his effectiveness as a sniper and his value in combat despite his fearful nature.

events.title: Jango's Defeat
events.description: Jango is defeated by Usopp's Kayaku Boshi with assistance from Zoro. He is left unconscious in the forest, marking the end of the Black Cat Pirates' second-in-command.
events.significance: Completes the defeat of the Black Cat Pirates' leadership and shows Usopp's growth as a fighter, building his confidence to join a real pirate crew.

events.title: Black Cat Pirates Flee Syrup Village
events.description: The remaining Black Cat Pirates take their defeated captain's body and flee the island on their ship, ending their threat to Syrup Village.
events.significance: Marks the end of the Black Cat Pirates' presence in the story and the successful defense of Syrup Village.

events.title: Villagers Keep Attack Secret
events.description: The villagers of Syrup Village decide to keep the pirate attack secret to maintain their peace of mind, reasoning that pirates do not normally come to such an out-of-the-way village.
events.significance: Shows the village's desire to return to normalcy and contrasts with Usopp's decision to embrace the reality of pirate life by joining Luffy's crew.

events.title: Going Merry Debut
events.description: The Going Merry, a caravel ship designed by Merry, is revealed for the first time. This ship will become the Straw Hat Pirates' first true vessel and home.
events.significance: The Going Merry becomes an iconic part of the series, serving as the crew's ship until the end of the Enies Lobby arc. This marks a major step forward in the crew's journey.

events.title: Kaya Gifts Going Merry to Straw Hats
events.description: Kaya, grateful for the Straw Hats saving her life and village, gifts them the Going Merry ship. Merry personally stocks the ship and explains its workings to the crew, particularly to Nami.
events.significance: The crew acquires their first proper ship, enabling them to truly begin their journey. This act of gratitude establishes the pattern of the crew earning ships and treasures through helping others.

events.title: Kaya's Recovery and Resolution
events.description: Kaya realizes that her confinement and grief over her parents' deaths caused her illness. With the threat eliminated and new hope from seeing the Straw Hats pursue their dreams, she recovers and decides to become a doctor.
events.significance: Completes Kaya's character arc in this story, showing how the Straw Hats inspired her to pursue her own dream and move forward from her grief.

events.title: Usopp Disbands His Pirate Crew
events.description: Usopp formally disbands his childhood 'pirate crew' (Piiman, Ninjin, and Tamanegi) with newfound confidence and maturity, preparing to join a real pirate crew and pursue his dreams.
events.significance: Marks Usopp's transition from playing at being a pirate to becoming a real pirate. Shows his growth and readiness to leave childhood behind.

events.title: Usopp Joins the Straw Hat Pirates
events.description: Usopp officially accepts Luffy's invitation to join the Straw Hat Pirates as their fourth member and the crew's sniper. He boards the Going Merry to begin his adventure on the seas.
events.significance: Usopp becomes the fourth member of the Straw Hat Pirates and their official sniper. This is a pivotal moment in building the core crew that will journey to the Grand Line.

events.title: Straw Hats Depart Syrup Village
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates depart Syrup Village aboard the Going Merry with their new crewmate Usopp, continuing their journey toward the Grand Line.
events.significance: Concludes the Syrup Village arc and marks the beginning of the crew's journey with their first proper ship, setting the stage for future adventures.

quotes.text: My plan...My plan...My plan cannot fail!!!
quotes.speaker: Kuro
quotes.context: Kuro's desperation as his three-year scheme collapses

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's new headbutt technique that defeats Kuro

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the power of pursuing one's dreams, as seen through Usopp joining the crew, Kaya deciding to become a doctor, and Luffy's unwavering determination to protect his friends' dreams.
themes.symbolism: The Going Merry represents the vehicle that will carry the crew's dreams forward. Kaya's gift symbolizes how helping others and staying true to your principles brings rewards.

themes.description: Usopp transitions from playing pirate with children to becoming a real pirate. Kaya moves past her grief and isolation to pursue a meaningful goal. Both characters grow beyond their previous limitations.
themes.symbolism: Usopp disbanding his childhood crew represents leaving the past behind to embrace the future.

themes.description: The bonds formed during the Syrup Village arc culminate in Usopp joining the crew and Kaya's generous gift of the Going Merry. These acts demonstrate the value of genuine friendship.
themes.symbolism: The ship itself becomes a symbol of the friendship between Kaya and the Straw Hats.

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his willingness to go all-out to protect others' dreams and shows tactical creativity by using a headbutt technique.
keyActions: Defeats Kuro with Gomu Gomu no Kane

characterSpotlights.development: Makes the transition from pretend pirate to real pirate crew member. Proves his worth in battle and gains the confidence to pursue his dreams at sea.
keyActions: Officially joins the Straw Hat Pirates

characterSpotlights.development: His careful plan completely unravels, and his arrogance and underestimation of the Straw Hats leads to his defeat and capture.
keyActions: Loses composure as his plan fails
quotes: My plan...My plan...My plan cannot fail!!!

characterSpotlights.development: Recovers from her illness and grief, finding new purpose. Demonstrates gratitude and generosity by gifting the Going Merry to the Straw Hats.
keyActions: Gifts the Going Merry to the Straw Hats

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the final battle sequences with additional action scenes not present in the manga.
The flashback to Banchina may have additional emotional emphasis in the anime compared to the manga's brief mention.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of the Going Merry, which will serve as the Straw Hat Pirates' ship for over 300 episodes until the end of the Enies Lobby arc.
Gomu Gomu no Kane (Rubber Rubber Bell) debuts in this episode and becomes one of Luffy's signature close-range techniques throughout the series.
This episode concludes the Syrup Village arc, which introduces Usopp, one of the most enduring members of the Straw Hat crew.
Banchina's debut in this episode provides important backstory for Usopp's character that will be referenced throughout the series.
